Text saved: Asteroids, which are rocks in space, come near Earth's path around the Sun, called an orbit. NASA, the American space agency, has made a map showing 1,400 asteroids called Potentially Hazardous Asteroids or PHAs; these are rocks that come within 7.5 million kilometres of Earth's orbit. None of these asteroids is expected to be a danger to Earth in the next 100 years. NASA already has technology to watch these asteroids and can predict if they might hit Earth. If this happens, NASA could use two defence methods to stop the impact and protect the planet.

Text saved: Asteroids are space rocks. Some of them come close to Earth’s path around the Sun. This path is called an orbit. NASA, the American space agency, has made a map that shows 1,400 asteroids called Potentially Hazardous Asteroids or PHAs. These rocks come within 7.5 million kilometres of Earth's orbit. None of these asteroids is expected to be a threat to Earth in the next 100 years. NASA has technology to watch these asteroids. They can guess if an asteroid might hit Earth. If that happens, NASA could use two defence ways to stop the impact and protect our planet.
